doc.after: The archaeological project then continues or alternatively begins with a field survey Regional survey is the attempt to systematically locate previously unknown sites in a region Site survey is the attempt to systematically locate features of interest such as houses and middens within a site Each of these two goals may be accomplished with largely the same methods
